title: 107_hr874
content:
The Hidden Rate Elimination Act of 2001, also known as the "Act," makes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It specifies that changes in tax rates under this Act do not apply to section 15 of the Code. Additionally, the Act reduces marginal income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses for the year 2002. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $12,000: 14% of taxable income
- Over $12,000 but not over $45,200: $1,680 plus 15% of the excess over $12,000
- Over $45,200 but not over $109,250: $6,660 plus 27% of the excess over $45,200
- Over $109,250 but not over $166,450: $23,953.50 plus 30% of the excess over $109,250
- Over $166,450 but not over $297,300: $41,113.50 plus 35% of the excess over $166,450
- Over $297,300: $86,911 plus 38% of the excess over $297,300. Heads of Households are subject to a separate tax on their taxable income. The tax rates for heads of households are based on taxable income and are determined according to a specific table. Tax rates for unmarried individuals (other than surviving spouses and heads of households) are based on taxable income and are determined according to a specific table. The tax rates range from 14% to 38% based on different income brackets. Tax rates for unmarried individuals are determined based on taxable income and are imposed according to a specific table. Tax rates for unmarried individuals are determined based on taxable income and are imposed according to a specific table. If taxable income is not over $6,000, the tax is 14% of taxable income. For incomes over $6,000 but not over $27,050, the tax is $840 plus 15% of the excess over $6,000. The tax rates increase progressively for higher income brackets. Married individuals who do not file jointly with their spouse are subject to a tax based on their taxable income, as per a specific table. Married individuals not filing jointly are taxed based on a specific table, with rates ranging from 14% to 38% based on taxable income brackets. Phasein of 2006 Rates of 10, 15, 25, and 33 Percent: Tax rates for taxable years after 2002 will be based on rates from 2002, with reductions in subsequent years for specific brackets. The tax rates for taxable years after 2002 will be based on rates from 2002, with reductions in subsequent years for specific brackets beginning in calendar year 2006. The Secretary will adjust tables to carry out the reductions under this subsection. Inflation adjustments will apply in determining rates for 2002, with specific changes to dollar amounts in certain brackets for taxable years after 2001 and before 2007. In later calendar years, the cost-of-living adjustment for tax tables after 2006 will be determined by substituting '2005' for '2000'. Various provisions are amended by replacing '1992' with '2000' in specific sections. The text chunk contains various sections of tax codes being amended by striking certain phrases and inserting new ones. Additional conforming amendments are also made to specific sections. Various sections of tax codes are being amended by replacing certain percentage values with new ones. For example, "28 percent" is changed to "15 percent", "39.6 percent" is replaced with "33 percent", and "31 percent" is amended to "25 percent" in different sections of the code. Additionally, other percentage values are also adjusted in various sections. The Secretary of the Treasury may adjust percentages to align with those in the Internal Revenue Code. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001, with specific withholding provisions effective for payments after the same date. The text chunk states the repeal of phaseouts of deduction for personal exemptions and itemized deductions. The text chunk discusses the repeal of the phaseout of personal exemptions in tax laws, including technical amendments to related sections. The repeal of the overall limitation on itemized deductions under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, with technical amendments to related sections, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2001.
